name: Ensure databases have TLS 1.2 or newer enabled
body: C﻿yscale looks for managed databases that instances have TLS enabled and its versions are no older than `1.2`. TLS `1.0` and `1.1` are vulnerable to downgrade attacks since they rely on SHA-1 hash for the integrity of exchanged messages.
remediationDescription:
D﻿epending on the provider and service that you use, check out the following resources:

#### A﻿WS
* [Using SSL/TLS to encrypt a connection to a DB instance](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/UsingWithRDS.SSL.html)

#### Azure
* [Configuring TLS settings in Azure Database for MySQL using Azure portal](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/mysql/single-server/how-to-tls-configurations)
* [Connect to Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server with encrypted connections](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/mysql/flexible-server/how-to-connect-tls-ssl)
* [Configure TLS connectivity in Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Single Server](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/postgresql/single-server/concepts-ssl-connection-security)
* [Encrypted connectivity using Transport Layer Security in Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/postgresql/flexible-server/how-to-connect-tls-ssl)

#### GCP
* [Configure SSL/TLS certificates](https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/mysql/configure-ssl-instance)

#### Alibaba
* [Configure SSL encryption for an ApsaraDB RDS for MySQL instance
](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/apsaradb-for-rds/latest/configure-ssl-encryption-on-an-apsaradb-rds-for-mysql-instance)
* [Configure SSL encryption for an ApsaraDB RDS for PostgreSQL instance
](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/apsaradb-for-rds/latest/configure-ssl-encryption-for-an-apsaradb-rds-for-postgresql-instance)
* [Configure SSL encryption on an ApsaraDB RDS for SQL Server instance
](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/apsaradb-for-rds/latest/configure-ssl-encryption-on-an-apsaradb-rds-for-sql-server-instance)
